akn:section.akn:heading: Reserve commissioned officers who have served as Attending Physician to the Congress: grade on trans

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 12772. Reserve commissioned officers who have served as Attending Physician to the Congress: grade on transfer to Retired Reserve Unless entitled to a higher grade under another provision of law, a reserve commissioned officer who is transferred to the Retired Reserve after having served in the position of Attending Physician to the Congress is entitled to be placed on the retired list established by section 12774(a) of this title in the grade held by the officer while serving in that position. (Added Pub. L. 103–337, div. A, title XVI, § 1662(k)(1), Oct. 5, 1994, 108 Stat. 3005.)
Editorial Notes Prior ProvisionsProvisions similar to those in this section were contained in section 1374(e) of this title, prior to repeal by Pub. L. 103–337, § 1662(k)(2).
Statutory Notes and Related Subsidiaries Effective DateSection effective Dec. 1, 1994, except as otherwise provided, see section 1691 of Pub. L. 103–337, set out as a note under section 10001 of this title.
